Description: Egyptian(izing) glazed composition 'common bowl'; mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue glaze and brown painted decoration; rounded bowl with hemispherical body, rounded rim and base; painted decoration represents a flying duck or swan with outspread wings; border of single wavy-line between parallel lines and dots; short strokes on the rim.
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 147, p. 56)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (p.157, fig. 2.3)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 187)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.3)
